definition: to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: A little later, Gao Yishan two of them then fainted on the table.
sentences.chinese: 不一會兒，高義山他們兩個便暈倒在桌子上。

sentences.english: Tutti executed a fabulous fake faint, swooning cartoonishly right to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 圖蒂假裝暈倒，像卡通人物似的昏倒在地。

sentences.english: As soon as he regretfully put down his gun, he fell unconscious and was earried away on a stretcher.
sentences.chinese: 他遺憾地一放下槍，就暈倒了，被人們用擔架擡走。

sentences.english: What chutian change Korea thin film very frustrated, even fainted in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 何楚天的改變讓韓疏影萬分失落，甚至暈倒在雨中。

sentences.english: When a constipation suggestion retired old person goes to the bathroom, faints suddenly in the place.
sentences.chinese: 便祕誘發型一離休老人如廁時，突然暈倒在地。

sentences.english: HongGuoRong anger extremely unquote, was angry faint in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 洪國榮怒極攻心，被氣的暈倒在地。

sentences.english: And the  spin  that the government puts on building a  harmonious society  is sickeningly syrupy.
sentences.chinese: 而且政府建立“和諧社會”的造勢甜得令人暈倒。

sentences.english: She fainted away at the sight of her own blood.
sentences.chinese: 她一見到自己的血就暈倒了過去。

sentences.english: In Britain, people fainted at the reading in Leeds.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，有人在利茲的朗讀會上暈倒。

sentences.english: No one fainted the first time I read the short story, 'Guts'.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讀《腸子》這個短篇故事的時候沒人暈倒。

sentences.english: Telpuk says she nearly fell over.
sentences.chinese: 泰爾普克說，她幾乎嚇得暈倒過去。

sentences.english: In a word, I was so surprised, that I fell down in a Swoon.
sentences.chinese: 一句話，我嚇得暈倒在抽水機旁。

sentences.english: Philoctetes cries out and faints from the extremity of his sufferings.
sentences.chinese: 菲羅克忒忒斯因爲極度的痛苦而大聲喊叫並且暈倒了。

sentences.english: The stranger conked him and he fainted.
sentences.chinese: 他被陌生人敲頭而暈倒。

sentences.english: Korea thin film will not, two people argue, thin film fall down the stairs faint in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 韓疏影不肯，二人爭執中，韓疏影跌下樓梯暈倒在地。

sentences.english: This poor old man is fainting with hunger,let him sit down and eat.
sentences.chinese: 這位可憐的老翁快暈倒了，讓他坐下來喫些東西。

definition: to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
